results.title: Saturn's return
results.creator_credit: Wenona Byrne, Helen Pankhurst and Christos Tsiolkas
results.brief_description: ‘Saturn’s return’ is part of an SBS commissioned series called ‘Hybrid Life’, which explores the experience of second and third generation migrants. Barney and his lover Dimi set out on a road trip to visit Barney’s father who is dying of AIDS and has decided to end his life. Based on a short story by Christos Tsiolkas and directed by Wenona Byrne, the film uses the road movie journey as a means to travel through Australia’s chequered history, while the two lovers confront their families turbulent past.

results.title: Synthing
results.brief_description: Synthing is the result of years of exploratory work across disciplines. “The Synthing concept puts expressive and energetic body movement in front of a video camera interface to create an engrossing interplay of music and images within the framework of a cybermedium… a synaesthetic compositional tool”, says Gruchy. Synthing, through its use of real-time navigation and interactive technologies, allows real opportunities for audience interaction.

results.title: How quest sought the truth
results.brief_description: Nathan Jurevicius has a unique and delightful animation style. How Quest sought the Truth is adapted from the Croatian Fairy story by Ivana Brlic Mazuranic. It tells the story of Witting and his three grandsons who live in the Forest. The grandson venture out to seek the wisdom of Alrosy but are tempted from their path by goblins. Quest eventually finds his way back.

results.title: SPAA Conference 2002
results.brief_description: The Screen Producers Conference is the key national industry conference and is to be held in Melbourne 2001, 2002 and 2003. The conference delegates represent the major broadcast networks, production houses and independent producers in Australia. The Conference is a three day event and usually coincides with the annual Australian Film Institute (AFI)Awards.

results.title: Expectant spaces
results.brief_description: A commissioned Public Imaging project by Melbourne cinematographer, Ben Speth. His extraordinary, meditative work manifests as a mysterious visual documentation of volume, light and time in deserted urban spaces. A sense of expectancy emerges through his still, ghostly and enigmatic images of spaces of waiting or anticipation - hospital emergency rooms, bus shelters, classrooms, dental waiting rooms, car parks.

results.title: Luke's Party
results.brief_description: A young woman sits herself in front of a video camera to document her struggles as a single mother. By the time she has finished dealing with her bills, her children’s demands, her best friend’s questions and trying to arrange her son’s birthday, we understand only too well how difficult life can be. A very funny and very affectionate look at working class urban life.

results.title: Panacea - The Documentary
results.brief_description: Panacea the Documentary follows the journey of Arena Theatre Company’s creative team as they embark on an ambitious large scale perfromance event fusing modern technology and cinematic devices. We follow the journey of the team as they wrestle with combining conventional theatre and MTV culture.

results.title: Panacea - the Soundtrack
results.brief_description:
A cast of ten, a teenage boy, live musicians, full musical score, six projection surfaces, digital animation and a sublime visual setting, mark this production as the largest ever produced by Arena.

Music Director: Hugh Covill
Music composed by: Hugh Covill with Rosemary Myers and Dave Watts

results.title: Collaborator
results.brief_description:
Collaborator presents a unique opportunity for teachers and students of theatre to explore issues, processes and the personnel associated with the creation of a new piece of Australian Theatre. This CD ROM provides insight into the creation of Arena Theatre Compnay’s PANACEA through interviews, formal and informal, with the artists involved and footage of the production in both rehearsal and in performance.

Peter Robert, Head of Drama, Yarra Valley Grammar School
